context_utils¶

Classes¶

BlockObjectSignals

def __init__()

Description¶

Context managers relating to the Qt API.

Usage¶

Context managers are used to encapsulate a code block in a specific context. They allow for a temporary state to exist while code is being executed and are initialised as follows:

with Context(args):
    completeActionsWithinContext()
class msTools.coreUI.qt.context_utils.BlockObjectSignals(obj)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily blocking signals emitted by an object (ie. an emitted signal will not invoke anything connected to it).

Blocking is completed via PySide2.QtCore.QObject.blockSignals().

__init__(obj)¶

Initialise the context.

Parameters:obj (T <= PySide2.QtCore.QObject) – The object for which to block signals.
class msTools.coreUI.qt.context_utils.DisableWidget(widget)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily disabling a widget.

Disabling is completed via PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget.setEnabled().

A disabled widget:

  • Does not handle keyboard and mouse events.
  • May render differently (eg. greyed out).
  • Implicitly disables all of its children.
__init__(widget)¶

Initialise the context.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to disable.
class msTools.coreUI.qt.context_utils.DisableWidgetUpdates(widget)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily disabling updates for a widget.

Disabling is completed via PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget.setUpdatesEnabled().

An updates disabled widget:

  • Does not receive paint events.
  • Implicitly disables updates to all of its children.

Upon exiting the context, a call to PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget.update() will be made for the widget.

__init__(widget)¶

Initialise the context.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget for which to disable updates.
class msTools.coreUI.qt.context_utils.DisconnectSignalFromReceiver(signal, receiver)¶

Bases: object

Context manager for temporarily disconnecting a signal from a receiver.

__init__(signal, receiver)¶

Initialise the context.

Parameters:
  • signal (PySide2.QtCore.Signal) – The emitter of a connection to receiver.
  • receiver (callable […, any] | PySide2.QtCore.Signal | PySide2.QtCore.Slot) – The receiver of a connection from signal.
